objdescid.compdate: c. 1779The date is based on stylistic considerations.

objinfo.objsize: 11.0 x 14.5 cm.This is the size of the sketch.

provenance.name: Tate collection
provenance.note: Probably inherited by Blake's wife Catherine at his death in 1827; acquired by Frederick Tatham, probably at Catherine Blake's death in 1831; Tatham's brother-in-law, George Richmond; sold from Richmond's collection, Christie's, 29 April 1897, lot 147 with 21 other works, most by Blake and his brother Robert (£2.10s. to Richard Sisley); Sisley's daughter, Mrs. John Richmond, probably by gift or inheritance; given by Mrs. Richmond to the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection) in 1922.

desc.objtitle:
Part of a Face,
object 1 (Butlin 178 verso)

objnote.p: The pencil inscriptions lower right, "3694 xviii" and "M.B. 81", are later additions not by Blake. For the pen and ink drawing on the recto, see Charon, Copy from the Antique(?).

illustration.illusobjdesc: In the upper left quadrant of this drawing, a partial face is visible with blank eyes, eyebrows, and a nose. These features face forward and slightly to the right. The face may have been copied from a sculpture.

component.illusobjdesc: In the upper left quadrant of this drawing, a partial face is visible with blank eyes, eyebrows, and a nose. These features face forward and slightly to the right. The face may have been copied from a sculpture.
